TambolaGame.title: TambolaGame
TambolaGame.description: Represents a single Tambola game session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Tambola game session.

startTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the game started.

endTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the game ended. Null if the game is in progress.

CalledNumber.title: CalledNumber
CalledNumber.description: Represents a single number called during a Tambola game.

id.description: Unique identifier for the called number event.

gameId.description: Reference to the TambolaGame. (Relationship: TambolaGame 1:N CalledNumber)

callTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the number was called.

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence in which the number was called (e.g., 1st, 2nd, 3rd number called).

definition.description: Stores the Tambola game sessions.  Each document represents a single game.  The 'gameId' is used as the document ID.

params.name: gameId
params.description: The unique identifier for the Tambola game session.

definition.description: Stores the numbers called during a specific Tambola game. Each document represents a single called number with its sequence and timestamp. 'gameId' links back to the TambolaGame document. The 'numberId' is the unique ID.

params.name: gameId
params.description: The unique identifier for the Tambola game session.

params.name: numberId
params.description: The unique identifier for the called number event.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to efficiently store and retrieve Tambola game data while ensuring scalability and security. It separates game sessions and called numbers into distinct collections with a hierarchical structure to maintain a clear relationship between them. The design prioritizes authorization independence. Since the application has no concept of roles or ownership beyond anonymous users, no denormalization is required.
